derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: via German from Italian, circulation (of money')

entry.tran: （政府提供给失业者或病人的）直接转账救济支票
entry.def: In Britain, a giro or a giro cheque is a cheque that is given by the government to a person who is unemployed or ill.

example.ex: He lived on an invalidity pension which came as a weekly giro.
example.tran: 他靠每周领取的作为病残养老金的直接转账救济支票过日子。

entry.tran: 银行（或邮局）直接转账体系
entry.def: Giro is a system in which banks and post offices transfer money directly from one bank account to another using computers.

example.ex: There will be no further costs as long as the bank is part of the giro network.
example.tran: 只要该银行属于直接转账系统，就不会额外收取费用。

means.word_mean: 1. a check given by the British government to someone who is unemployed; it can be cashed either at a bank or at the post office
2. a British financial system in which a bank or a post office transfers money from one account to another when they receive authorization to do so
